msContents.summary: Two receipts for "adaeratio" of taxes in kind which were written on the same day: the first refers to payment made by Kopres; in the second the payers are the "sitologoi" of the village of Ptolemais; the receiver was Eulogios

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 19 lines; the back is blank
Mark of kollesis in the middle of the first col.; broken at right and damaged
Very fast ligatured hand that is difficult to read

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 7 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: In the consulate of Nepotianus and Facundus the most illustrious, Choiak 10, Kopres paid for adaeratio of the eighth indiction for Ptolemais of Karanis sixty talents, that is, 60 tal. Pharmouthi, the same man likewise for Ptolemais of Karanis, nine talents, 9 tal. Eulogios through me, Horion. In the consulate of Nepotianus and [Facundus the] most illustrious, Choiak 10. ... and his partners, sitologoi, paid for adaeratio of the eighth indiction for Ptolemais of Karanis, forty talents, that is, 40 tal. And on the 12th likewise the same men for adaeratio of the eighth indiction for Ptolemais of Karanis, fifty talents, that is, [50] tal. Eulogios through me, Horion.
